title: RoboFab
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Software](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Software) : RoboFab**

RoboFab is a set of tools written for [Python](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Python) designed to help programming tasks common in [type design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/type%20design). While RoboFab can be used in conjunction with Python scripts in [FontLab](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontLab), it can also be used in independent Python programs. RoboFab was/is developed by [Tal Leming](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tal%20Leming), [Erik van Blokland](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erik%20van%20Blokland), [Just van Rossum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Just%20van%20Rossum) of [Letterror](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Letterror) fame.

**URL**  
 [http://robofab.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/robofab.com/ "http://robofab.com/")

**Installation** _on Mac OS X_  
Installing RoboFab on Mac OSX 10.5 can be difficult. Useful comments and an installer script by Erik van Blokland:  
 [http://robofab.com/download/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/robofab.com/download/index.html)  
 [http://robofab.com/install.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/robofab.com/install.html)

Also see [this post](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/groups.google.com/group/robofab/browse_thread/thread/35bedec16bda51c9#82f6375f89c27144) to the [RoboFab Group](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331162651/http:/groups.google.com/group/robofab/).
